intro: Ornithogalum algeriense, commonly known as Algerian star-of-Bethlem, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its bulbous root system and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces clusters of white, star-shaped flowers during the spring and summer seasons. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
